Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine buff-brown. Rectangular stamp. Rhodian fabricant.
Curator's comments: Name Diskos. Perhaps from same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0262.11, which has a symbol, skyphos or krater, at right edge, worn on this piece.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (136)
